author: pk910
content:
We've tried the latest electra images with >4098 validators to get more than one committee per slot to test the new attestation aggregation.
Looks like this is not working yet for any of the involved clients (lodestar / grandine). After electra got activated we can't se any attestations on the network anymore (and therefore obviously no finalization)

Repro kurtosis config:
```
participants:
  - el_type: geth
    el_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/ethpandaops/geth:lightclient-prague-devnet-0
    cl_type: grandine
    cl_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/ethpandaops/grandine:feature-electra
    count: 2
  - el_type: nethermind
    el_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/nethermindeth/nethermind:pectra
    cl_type: lodestar
    cl_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/ethpandaops/lodestar:electra-fork
    count: 2
  - el_type: ethereumjs
    el_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/ethpandaops/ethereumjs:master
    cl_type: lodestar
    cl_image: 192.168.45.152:80/dh/ethpandaops/lodestar:electra-fork
    count: 2
network_params:
  electra_fork_epoch: 1
  num_validator_keys_per_node: 1000
additional_services:
  - dora
  - apache
snooper_enabled: true
```

author: yperbasis
content: About EIP-6110. The engine API spec says that the amount is in GWei. Is it also emitted in GWei in the deposit events or do we have to convert between Wei & GWei on the EL side?

author: __kasey__
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/deposit-contract.md#deposit-amount

It's rounded down to gwei in the deposit event log: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/solidity_deposit_contract/deposit_contract.sol#L115-L126

author: m.kalinin
content: The deposit contract tracks amount in Gwei, so the only thing EL has to do is to do endiannes conversion
